results.headline: Serious Adulthood Waiting to Happen
results.summary_short: Dating, flirting and fighting boredom, with a dying father in the background.

results.headline: The Man, the Magazine, the Mansion: The World According to Hef
results.summary_short: A documentary about Hugh Hefner says that beyond the hedonism, there is an equal-rights advocate who is overlooked.

results.headline: How Can You Enjoy Your Own Funeral? For Starters, Don’t Die

results.headline: Charming Socialites, Although Palm Beach Is Still Out of Reach
results.summary_short: A tale of an older asexual gadabout, a throwback to the age of “the confirmed bachelor,” and a young man who hopes to be a writer.

results.summary_short: “Dinner for Schmucks” is in some ways an exemplary modern Hollywood comedy.

results.headline: Getting the Old Band Back Together
results.summary_short: “The Concert,” by the Romanian director Radu Mihaileanu, is a kind of French-Russian answer to “The Producers.”

results.headline: Playing With Phantoms in the Northwest Woods
results.summary_short: In a melodrama touched by the supernatural, Zac Efron cares for his dead younger brother.

results.headline: When Pets Reach Across the Aisle
results.summary_short: “Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore” is a spy-and-action-film pastiche that charms less than its predecessor, “Cats & Dogs” (2001).

results.headline: Shades of ‘Happiness,’ Appalling and Funny

results.headline: A Hurricane of Misery

results.headline: Spies, Spider Venom and Sex Appeal
results.summary_short: In “Salt,” Angelina Jolie is a reminder that even in an era of technological overkill, movie stars matter.

results.headline: Mismatched Sisters
results.summary_short: With “Ramona and Beezus,” parents may be happy to see a movie for children that doesn’t involve wizards, vampires or action figures.

results.headline: Fighting His Country to Keep His Farmland
results.summary_short: Lucy Bailey and Andrew Thompson’s documentary examines a farmer’s efforts to hold on to his property in the face of land seizures.

results.headline: French Connection: K.G.B. Colonel Plotting to Break the Isolation

results.headline: Nuclear Fears
results.summary_short: Paying to see “Countdown to Zero” is like tipping a fortuneteller to predict the manner of your death.

results.headline: A Slice of Midwestern Mumblecore
results.summary_short: “Audrey the Trainwreck” suggests Robert Altman without any of Altman’s instincts for character and poetry.

results.headline: A Friend, an Artist and a Personal Interview
results.summary_short: Tamra Davis’s documentary, a romantic depiction of Jean-Michel Basquiat, blazingly brings to life the artist’s work and its cultural context.
